result.execSummary:
The defendant James Edward Karriker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 10 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 4 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence.

Court ordered defendant Provide a DNA sample.

Court ordered the defendant pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by 10/15/2016.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter.

Filed:      
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant James Edward Karriker in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant James Edward Karriker in custody.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Attorney Alexis Liggins in court, defendant James Edward Karriker not in court, in custody.  Katie Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea hearing, however defense requests more time, defendant has pending jury trial in Branch 38.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant James Edward Karriker in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant James Edward Karriker in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for motion hearing.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee County Sheriff Detective Brian Morgan.  Arguments heard.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court DENIED the defense motion to suppress. Defense requests plea hearing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Discharge Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Status Update Report, received and filed.

Defendant James Edward Karriker in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant James Edward Karriker in custody.  
David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Motion Hearing.  Defense was in jury trial in another branch.  Due to the lateness of the hour the Court is unable to hear this matter on today; adjourned date selected.  Defendant in custody pending new charges.  Parties advised effective August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22, Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant James Edward Karriker in court.  Attorney Alexis Liggins, via telephone, as she is out ill.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.

Defendant James Edward Karriker in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant James Edward Karriker in custody.  Ron Dague for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Fiorenza.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Watts, Br. 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant James Edward Karriker in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant James Edward Karriker in custody.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
